chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawna Kathleen Allegro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: joint and several with co defendants Pierce County 15CF2 and 15CM6

Comply with any conditions imposed by the agent.
DNA sample.

9:18  Defendant Shawna Kathleen Allegro in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie files an amended information with the court.  Plead to charge in amended information  Probation 3 years.  Cond  Restitutuion Joint and sev with co-defendants.  Approx  1300- 1400  30 days to submit the amount to the court.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charge in the amended information   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge in the amended information. Court orders - S/W Probation 3 years. Conditions Court costs. DNA sample.   Comply with the conditions imposed by the agent.  Resitiution to be det with in  30 days.  Jt and Sev with the co defenant. Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

State requests the warrant be quashed and the $5000 sign bond be reinstated.  Warrant authorization is quashed.  The $5000  sign  bond is reinstated. Jury trial will remain on the calendar
